comments.body: What about Kimbap? It could swap the fish for cooked porkchop in the recipe.

Nah, not Strawberry. There's no strawberry in Minecraft. Sweet Berry cake instead!

Vanilla cake would just be called Cake and use the normal recipe.
Ok, that sounds like a great idea ! Hope mojang will add that!

It would be nice if the furnace minecart could be controlled like a locomotive. The lack of controls and lack of switches that don't involve some convoluted redstone configuration makes the minecart train useless. Minecart trains with several minecart hoppers or minecart chests could be very useful for transporting large quantities. It could create a new variant in the game.
Good idea.  Maybe you could put coal in to get them going, and then right-click them to stop them.  And they should also be stopped by unpowered rails.
I  would love to use them to make railroads.  Great idea!
True We Need THIS
Creative idea! Kinda like Looting!
This is a great idea! Hopefully they add it eventually
The problem is if they added this it would probably be looting OR this enchantment on a sword at one time
I want sandwich in Minecraft
Sandwich in Minecraft has been an idea of mine for sooo long as well
That would be pretty sick to be able to make custom sandwiches

So is hay isn't sturdy look at the three little pigs and big bad wolf.
Wool stair will be very good for couches
This would be such a banger
I LIKE DIS!!
What would the ore do
Be like the others, but stronger than Netherite. Maybe some kind of damage boost when wearing the full armor set?

This idea is meant to give Moonstone a use for late-game players while keeping Netherite as the best tool. While Moonstone Swords might be better than Netherite Swords, A Netherite Pickaxe is probably more useful for mining. Both Moonstone and Netherite are a good choice for armor, depending on how much you use it and if you have mending.
Yo similar to my idea, check it out.

Sure, as kids we all fantasized about something better than diamond gear... EMERALD GEAR! But at this point it would be impractical. Mojang has specified that under no circumstances would they add emerald tools/armor into the game, emeralds were specifically used as currency. Then, if it was somehow better than netherite, then there would be no purpose in netherite. It would ruin progression and unbalance the game.
i don't think it shoud be in minecraft. emeralds are too fragile
The trading mechanic is interesting, but I don't think it warrants an entirely new post. This should have been a comment on one of the other many emerald armor/tool/weapon posts
Emeralds are too easy to get, and there would be no real way to implement this into the game.
Emeralds are too easy to get, and there would be no real way to implement this into the game.
They should add like a option to make it have a visor on a helmet
but you can use blaze rods as fuel in furnaces, so nothing makes sense at all! How come blazes don't take fire damage if blaze rods burn!
This would not make sense due to the fact that you use them for fuel in furnaces. Interesting concept but it would not make any sense

As a reply to the previous to comments, the fact that you use them in furnaces doesn't mean they can burn. You use lava as fuel but lava doesn't burn. it just means blaze rods are heat emitters, like fire itself.

I'd like to add to this suggestion: Any nether-exclusive mob's loot shouldn't burn. Wither skeleton skulls are hard to get, and wither skeletons don't burn. Therefore, their skulls shouldn't burn. Ghast tears and magma cream as well.
This would be useful if it activates whatever it rides over
but this is why detector rails where invented
What I mean is that you could have a line of unpowered rails, and when this rides over the rails it would power them. Sure, it's like detector rails, so it wouldn't be too useful
not just water about milk and lava too?

I agree.
Some blocks are also acailable as a slab and stairs.
Like the quartz and some stones.
But some are only available as a block.
For example the concrete blocks.
If they would also be available as a slab and/or stairs we could build nicer buildings, streets, highways, landshapes, etcetera. For a up- and down going street or highway we can do it with a slab. Would look much better than with a block.

This would benefit the game it several ways. It would benefit the architect side of the community. The edition of Green-fire would allow it new tint on builds. This goes for me personally, being a builder, but I always wanted to build a large Nether Fortress, and the edition of green-colored light sources would greatly improve the look of that build. Of course, this is only one example.

 

Next, it would add a new use to copper. While the edition of the Lightning rod, and Spyglass are incredible, and I'm looking forward to using these items, but these would widen the small range of use of copper (at least that we know of so far.)

 

It could also benefit the automotive community of the game. These items could be given a feature(s) that would affect the Redstone community. One of the recommendations I've heard elsewhere, was that it could draw mobs to it, just like green light does in real life. That feature could be used in farms, just like ravagers are used in iron farms. I don't know of any other Redstone ideas, because I am not a Redstone Engineer, but some interesting ideas could be added.

 

For the PvP/PvE players, some new mechanics could be added as well.
Weathered copper should be used. This is actually copper oxide, which burns with a green fire. THAT is the salt.
I would use Copper Nuggets instead of Copper Ingots.
woa, that's a great idea, that could work for maps or mechanics.
Maybe we should be using lightning rods instead.
I thought you could do this, so I was designing a blast chamber farm that doesn't rely on duped tnt. I was sorely disappointed.
This seems too specific. I would instead add sandeiches that are customizable like soups and stews
We have to call them Hamboirgoirs
Truly American.

Now the new Froglights have been added, and the candles, and the glow lichen, and glow berries (and sea pickles not in OP's list) there really are a lot of light sources - I was going to post a similar feedback for Caves & Cliffs but thought it might be better to boost this old post.

It's not easy to search for light sources because they're not named consistently, unlike slabs or logs, so this would be really useful.
